questions.text: The average daily dietary nutrient intake level sufficient to meet the nutrient requirements of nearly all (97-98%) healthy individuals in a particular life stage and gender group is known as (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Recommended dietary allowance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA)
  • ➤ Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA)
  • ➤ Definition: RDA is a level of intake corresponding to Mean + 2 Standard Deviation, which covers requirement of 97.5% of population RDA is safe level of intake which is likely to be inadequate in not more than 2.5% population RDA is decided by a panel of experts and is based on scientific research RDA is often higher than the recommended minimum requirement: RDA includes both daily requirement and some additional requirement for periods of growth or illness RDA is based on Estimated Average Requirement RDA ‘safe level approach’ is not used for energy since excess energy intake is undesirable. For energy: only mean or average requirement is defined as RDA.
  • ➤ Definition: RDA is a level of intake corresponding to Mean + 2 Standard Deviation, which covers requirement of 97.5% of population
  • ➤ RDA is safe level of intake which is likely to be inadequate in not more than 2.5% population
  • ➤ RDA is decided by a panel of experts and is based on scientific research
  • ➤ RDA is often higher than the recommended minimum requirement: RDA includes both daily requirement and some additional requirement for periods of growth or illness
  • ➤ RDA is based on Estimated Average Requirement
  • ➤ RDA ‘safe level approach’ is not used for energy since excess energy intake is undesirable.
  • ➤ For energy: only mean or average requirement is defined as RDA.

questions.text: Which of the following laboratory test is used to diagnose rotavirus diarrhea? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Antigen detection in the stool sample

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigen detection in the stool sample
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Antigen detection in the stool sample

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antigen detection in stool samples is the standard diagnostic approach for confirming rotavirus infection, crucial for implementing appropriate management strategies, especially in managing dehydration risks in young children.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is NOT true regarding the electrolyte composition of 'ReSoMal' oral rehydration salts solution used for malnourished children? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • ReSoMal (Rehydration Solution for Malnutrition) is specifically formulated for rehydrating children with severe acute malnutrition (SAM). The sodium content in ReSoMal is 45 mmol/L, not 65 mmol/L as stated in option C. This reduced sodium concentration is intentional because malnourished children have excess body sodium despite presenting with low serum sodium levels. The standard WHO ORS contains 90 mmol/L sodium, which is too high for malnourished children.
  • • The correct composition of ReSoMal includes:
  • • Sodium: 45 mmol/L Potassium: 40 mmol/L Chloride: 70 mmol/L Glucose: 125 mmol/L Magnesium: 3 mmol/L Zinc: 0.3 mmol/L Copper: 0.045 mmol/L
  • • Sodium: 45 mmol/L
  • • Potassium: 40 mmol/L
  • • Chloride: 70 mmol/L
  • • Glucose: 125 mmol/L
  • • Magnesium: 3 mmol/L
  • • Zinc: 0.3 mmol/L
  • • Copper: 0.045 mmol/L
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Copper 0.045 mmol/L - Correct . ReSoMal contains copper at a concentration of 0.045 mmol/L, which helps address micronutrient deficiencies common in malnourished children.
  • • Option A. Copper 0.045 mmol/L - Correct
  • • Option B. Potassium 40 mmol/L - Correct . ReSoMal has increased potassium (40 mmol/L) compared to standard ORS (20 mmol/L) to address potassium depletion in malnourished children.
  • • Option B. Potassium 40 mmol/L - Correct
  • • Option D. Magnesium 3 mmol/L - Correct . ReSoMal contains magnesium at 3 mmol/L to help correct magnesium deficiency commonly seen in severe malnutrition.
  • • Option D. Magnesium 3 mmol/L - Correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ReSoMal has a lower sodium concentration (45 mmol/L) and higher potassium concentration (40 mmol/L) than standard ORS to address the specific electrolyte abnormalities in severe acute malnutrition. This specialized formulation helps prevent complications like heart failure during rehydration therapy in malnourished children.

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic patient presented to the casualty with confusion, ataxia, and painful eye movements. What could be the vitamin deficiency seen in this patient?(NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Vitamin B deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Wernicke encephalopathy – An acute, reversible but life-threatening condition. Clinical Vignette include Confusion, Ophthalmoplegia, Nystagmus, Ataxia.

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman presents with a rapidly growing, painless mass in her right breast that she first noticed about 3 months ago. On physical examination, the mass is well-circumscribed, lobulated, and larger than 5 cm in diameter. A history of a similar lesion occurred 2 years back also. A core needle biopsy is performed, and the histological examination reveals the image as shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Phyllodes tumor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phyllodes tumors are rapidly growing, lobulated breast masses with characteristic leaf-like stromal projections on histology, commonly seen in middle-aged women, and may recur.

questions.text: A 17-year-old girl presents to the emergency and is found to have raised blood pressure, tachycardia, diaphoresis, and mydriasis. The mother reports that she saw her consuming a substance in an unknown dose. What is the likely substance? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cocaine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cocaine intoxication is associated with signs of sympathetic overactivity, including elevated blood pressure, tachycardia, diaphoresis, and mydriasis.

questions.text: A young girl has been experiencing repeated instances of yeast infections and respiratory virus infections since she was only 3 months old. Given her immune system's condition, which of the listed vaccines should not be administered to her? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Measles/MMR

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Live vaccines like Measles/MMR should not be administered to immunocompromised individuals due to the risk of severe infection. Instead, inactivated or subunit vaccines, which do not contain live pathogens, should be used.

questions.text: Which of these is true regarding this? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: EMLA means equal mixture of LA

options.label: C
options.text: Methemoglobinemia is a complication of this cream

questions.correct_answer: C. Methemoglobinemia is a complication of this cream
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ EMLA cream can cause methemoglobinemia as a complication, especially when used inappropriately or in large quantities.

questions.text: A patient present with an X-ray showing cardiomegaly, along with symptoms of hypotonia, macroglossia, hepatomegaly, and "floppy baby" syndrome. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pompe's disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pompe's disease is characterized by the combination of cardiomegaly, muscle hypotonia, hepatomegaly, and macroglossia, often presenting as "floppy baby" syndrome due to lysosomal storage of glycogen.

questions.text: A diabetic truck driver presents to you with cough and breathlessness. A diagnosis of pneumonia was confirmed, and histopathological examination revealed dichotomous branching, as shown below. What is the likely causative agent? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Aspergillus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of respiratory infections in immunocompromised patients, the presence of dichotomous branching at acute angles in histopathological examination should prompt consideration of Aspergillus infection, necessitating prompt antifungal therapy to manage the potential for invasive disease.

questions.text: Which of the following is a formal thought disorder? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Derailment

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Formal thought disorders pertain to abnormalities in the organization, associations and connections of the thought. Derailment, loose associations, neologisms are examples of a formal thought disorder.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Kaplan and Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 12th edition, Page No 10

questions.text: A patient with bloody diarrhea. Flask-shaped ulcers seen. Infection due to ingestion of quadrinucleate cysts. What is the appropriate treatment? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Metronidazole

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient presenting with bloody diarrhea and flask-shaped ulcers caused by Entamoeba histolytica, the appropriate treatment is Metronidazole. This medication is effective against the invasive trophozoite stage of the parasite.

questions.text: A 25-year primigravida is on indomethacin (25mg TDS) for polyhydramnios till 35 weeks. What abnormality can the fetus have if she goes into labor now? (NEET PG 2021)

options.label: C
options.text: Premature closure of the ductus arteriosus

options.label: D
options.text: Premature closure of the ductus venosus

questions.correct_answer: C. Premature closure of the ductus arteriosus
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Premature closure of the ductus arteriosus

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Indomethacin and Fetal Effects:
  • • Indomethacin and Fetal Effects:
  • • Indomethacin is a non-selective cyclo-oxygenase inhibitor used in obstetrics primarily for two indications: Polyhydramnios: To reduce the excessive amniotic fluid. Tocolytic in preterm labor: To delay preterm labor. Mechanism: Indomethacin works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, which are important for maintaining the patency of the ductus arteriosus in the fetus. Risks: When used beyond 32 weeks of gestation, indomethacin can cause premature closure of the ductus arteriosus , leading to complications such as: Pulmonary hypertension Right ventricular hypertrophy Heart failure
  • • Indomethacin is a non-selective cyclo-oxygenase inhibitor used in obstetrics primarily for two indications: Polyhydramnios: To reduce the excessive amniotic fluid. Tocolytic in preterm labor: To delay preterm labor.
  • • Indomethacin
  • • Polyhydramnios: To reduce the excessive amniotic fluid. Tocolytic in preterm labor: To delay preterm labor.
  • • Polyhydramnios: To reduce the excessive amniotic fluid.
  • • Polyhydramnios:
  • • Tocolytic in preterm labor: To delay preterm labor.
  • • Tocolytic in preterm labor:
  • • Mechanism: Indomethacin works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, which are important for maintaining the patency of the ductus arteriosus in the fetus.
  • • Mechanism:
  • • Risks: When used beyond 32 weeks of gestation, indomethacin can cause premature closure of the ductus arteriosus , leading to complications such as: Pulmonary hypertension Right ventricular hypertrophy Heart failure
  • • Risks:
  • • premature closure of the ductus arteriosus
  • • Pulmonary hypertension Right ventricular hypertrophy Heart failure
  • • Pulmonary hypertension
  • • Right ventricular hypertrophy
  • • Heart failure
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Flap closure of foramen ovale: The foramen ovale normally closes soon after birth when the pressure in the left atrium exceeds the pressure in the right atrium. Indomethacin does not affect the closure of the foramen ovale.
  • • Option A. Flap closure of foramen ovale:
  • • Option B. Patent ductus arteriosus: Patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) is a condition where the ductus arteriosus remains open after birth. Indomethacin is actually used to treat PDA by promoting its closure, not causing it.
  • • Option B. Patent ductus arteriosus:
  • • Option D. Premature closure of the ductus venosus: The ductus venosus allows oxygenated blood from the umbilical vein to bypass the liver and flow directly into the inferior vena cava. Indomethacin does not influence the closure of the ductus venosus.
  • • Option D. Premature closure of the ductus venosus:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Indomethacin can cause premature closure of the ductus arteriosus if used beyond 32 weeks of gestation.
  • ➤ Ref: Page 679, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 679, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the ABG findings: (FMGE JULY 2024) pH – 7.28, PaCO2 – 28 mm Hg, PaO2 – 98 mm Hg, Na – 140 mEq/L, K – 4.9 mEq/L, HCO3 – 14 mEq/L, Cl – 100 mEq/L.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Metabolic acidosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Metabolic acidosis is indicated by a low pH and low HCO3, with the same direction of changes in both parameters. A high anion gap indicates the presence of unmeasured anions, often seen in conditions like diabetic ketoacidosis, lactic acidosis, and renal failure.

questions.text: Which of the following is accumulated in joint in the mucopolysaccharidosis associated with Natowicz disease? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Hyaluronic acid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Natowicz disease (MPS type IX) is characterized by hyaluronidase deficiency leading to accumulation of hyaluronic acid in joints, causing joint pain and short stature.
  • ➤ (MPS type IX)

questions.text: A child was brought to the OPD complaining of swelling in the neck region, which moves with deglutition and protrusion of the tongue. Which of the following is the correct treatment? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Sistrunk procedure is the definitive treatment for a thyroglossal duct cyst, involving the excision of the cyst, the entire thyroglossal tract, and part of the hyoid bone to ensure complete removal and prevent recurrence.

questions.text: A 4-week-old child was brought to the emergency with recurrent episodes of non-bilious vomiting. He was dehydrated. What should be corrected before performing surgical treatment in this baby? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis (IHPS) is often associated with hypokalemic, hypochloremic metabolic alkalosis. Correction of hypokalemia is essential before surgical intervention.

questions.text: MTP for failure of contraception can be done till: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 20 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Under the MTP Amendment Act of 2021, MTP for failure of contraception can be performed up to 20 weeks with the opinion of one doctor.
  • ➤ 20 weeks

questions.text: A 56-year-old man was diagnosed with COVID-19 and was put on mechanical ventilation. He passed away after a week. What is the likely post-mortem change seen in the lungs? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Thick layer of fibrin lining the alveoli

options.label: D
options.text: Pulmonary artery hypertrophy with increased resistance

questions.correct_answer: A. Thick layer of fibrin lining the alveoli
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Thick layer of fibrin lining the alveoli

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with severe COVID-19, especially those who have been on mechanical ventilation, the likely post-mortem finding in the lungs is a thick layer of fibrin lining the alveoli, indicative of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe diffuse alveolar damage.

questions.text: Identify the organism given below. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endothrix infections involve fungal elements within the hair shaft, commonly caused by specific Trichophyton species. In the absence of these species as answer options, the organism that affects hair (Microsporum) should be considered.

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and is diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia without atypia based on an endometrial biopsy. What is the most appropriate treatment option for her? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Levonorgestrel Intrauterine System (LNG-IUS)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Remember that LNG-IUS is the preferred treatment for endometrial hyperplasia without atypia due to its local progesterone delivery, which causes endometrial atrophy. This condition has a lower risk of malignancy (~1%) compared to hyperplasia with atypia, which requires hysterectomy.

questions.text: A person went for a trip on hills and developed difficulty breathing. He was given a diuretic which is considered as the drug of choice for this condition. What is the site of action of this drug? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) PCT (Proximal Convoluted Tubule)

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The clinical scenario describes acute mountain sickness, characterized by breathing difficulty at high altitudes due to hypoxia. The drug of choice for both prevention and treatment of mountain sickness is acetazolamide. Acetazolamide is a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor that acts primarily in the proximal convoluted tubule (PCT). It inhibits the reabsorption of bicarbonate in the PCT, causing mild metabolic acidosis which stimulates breathing and helps acclimatization to high altitude.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Thick ascending loop - Loop diuretics like furosemide act here, not acetazolamide
  • • Option B. Thick ascending loop -
  • • Option C. DCT (Distal Convoluted Tubule) - Thiazide diuretics act here, not carbonic anhydrase inhibitors
  • • Option C. DCT (Distal Convoluted Tubule) -
  • • Option D. Collecting duct - Potassium-sparing diuretics and aldosterone antagonists act here, not carbonic anhydrase inhibitors
  • • Option D. Collecting duct -

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A carbonic anhydrase inhibitor, is the drug of choice for mountain sickness and acts in the proximal convoluted tubule.
  • ➤ Diuretics Classification Table
  • ➤ Diuretics Classification Table

questions.text: Which of the following is true about Tuberculosis of the Hip during the Stage of Synovitis? (NEET PG 2016)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TB Hip Stage I (synovitis) presents with the hip in flexion, abduction, and external rotation, resulting in apparent lengthening due to downward pelvic tilt compensating for abduction deformity, while true limb lengths remain equal.

questions.text: In which of the following meniscal tears will meniscectomy be a more suitable option than meniscal repair? (NEET PG 2017)

options.label: D
options.text: Tears at the junction of the anterior horn of the medial meniscus & tibial collateral ligament

questions.correct_answer: C. Tears in the inner zone
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Meniscectomy is preferred for tears in the inner avascular 2/3rd of the meniscus due to poor healing potential, while tears in the vascular peripheral 1/3rd are better treated with repair.

questions.text: Which of the following structures is not a part of the auditory pathway? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.correct_answer: C. Genu of the internal capsule
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The auditory pathway involves the trapezoid body, lateral lemniscus, inferior colliculus, and medial geniculate body before reaching the auditory cortex via the sublentiform (not genu) part of the internal capsule.
